alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:47PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Walla Walla and southern Columbia Counties through 915 PM PDT... At 846 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dixie, or 7 miles northeast of Walla Walla, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walla Walla, Dayton, Waitsburg, Dixie, Huntsville, Ski Bluewood and Kooskooskie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
